pros: Clearance bonus, smart co-workers and a nice scif facility. Decent tc
cons: Ops monkey and horrendous oncall rotation. Leadership(middle manager) micro manages and asks for chat logs.

pros: Chill team with reasonable oncall and good pay. Finding myself working <40 hours a week
cons: Recently the vision hasn’t been clear. The team I’m working in is very top down, and it’s not up to the engineers to produce things they believe in. Rather we produce what the leadership believes in (AI)

summary: Good money, PMs are cannon fodder
pros: Good pay, really fascinating working within AWS and seeing how the sausage is made. Amazing customer interaction/ access.
cons: PM culture makes you feel unleveraged, micromanaged, documents culture is savage, surprisingly hard to measure things and make data driven decisions

summary: Good opportunities, Culture can be challenging
pros: Decent pay compared to non-FAANG companies, good work to be done depending on the org and project
cons: Infighting between leadership can inhibit your ability to succeed in your role, currently hard to get promoted or get a raise, not a design centric culture

pros: Good compensation, learn a lot by doing a lot. Lots of opportunities.
cons: Sometimes growth can become stagnant on the same team. Bad PIP. Culture was great pre covid, has significantly worsened since then.

summary: If you know what you are looking for, it will be a good place
pros: If you know what you are looking for, it will be a good place, team varies largely, but there are also a lot of internal opportunities
cons: You may end up in a bad team or org, but you can move away from it

summary: Great compensation and opportunity to work on hard problems
pros: You get to work with very smart people on some of the hard problems in software engineering
cons: Tight deadlines with difficult work life balance at times. SDEs have to wear multiple hats of PM, Release management and project management at times rather than focusing on technical problems.

pros: I don’t have anything good to say about the company
cons: I hate everything about this job and this company honestly
reasonResign: It’s just not really worth it to work at Amazon

pros: The compensation is good. The teammates were fine, but not helpful as they were busy themselves .
cons: Very toxic culture. Excepts a lot without providing guidance.  Do not recommend it.

pros: Not too bad WLB for my team. Great team environment.
cons: The scope is small. Not a good place for career growth. Low compensation

summary: Intense culture, pay is blah, but you know what you are getting into
pros: Data driven culture (or at least they try to be)
cons: Career growth at senior level is limited and promotiong is getting much more difficult

pros: Paid enough to afford therapy; gained experience with production-level large-scale ML systems that are hard to find/experiment with elsewhere
cons: RTO5; absolutely appalling politics and favoritism that encourages lying and sabotaging; somehow has both resistance to changes and recklessness to jump on any LLM hype

summary: Great WLB, Strong Culture, bad career path
pros: Great WLB, Strong Culture, customer first, everyday you have access to the last technologies to learn in AI
cons: Leaders of leaders must improve the long term view and career paths for managers

pros: It’s good on the resume and they pay a lot of money
cons: Work isn’t interesting, benefits suck compared to other top companies

summary: Lots of impact but at the expense of work/life balance
pros: Lots of opportunity to have ownership and impact. Learned a ton here
cons: Work/life balance is not great. You always feel like you have to be doing more.

pros: Good pay, modern office setting with clean tech and good surface vibes
cons:
Toxic management 
Teammates actively preventing each other from succeeding
Blame shift scapegoat culture

summary: All good things come to an end. The failures haven’t led to innovation, they’ve led to the casualty of Day 1 culture.
pros: The people are smart and you can do well if you’re able to tune out the noise and not get distracted.
cons: There is a cult like baptism that starts during the hiring process. The “peculiar” ways of operating are real. It is necessary to adapt to these ways to be heard and influence others. Push back is a key component of communication at Amazon. Accountability for leadership is completely non existent. Bad decisions are made (ex:over hiring; extremely aggressive targets) and those that pay for the bad decisions are those doing the hard work.

pros: Fast paced, good career trajectory if you can grind it out
cons: comp is kinda bad compared to peer companies. A lot of the work is just busy work and not important to overall business

summary: No longer day-1, customer obsessed company
pros: Learn operating at scale, vast diversity, Good company to start career
cons: Moved from customer obsession to leadership obsession, no longer a company that innovates, mostly a copy cat

pros: Compensation is solid and you work with some very talented people
cons: Lack of security, I've never felt secure or that my team is adding enough value

summary: Started with a great company to work but not any more.
pros: None worth mentioning. Every system is already built by other team.
cons: This ship is going down. Its day 2 for Amazon. Everyone is getting pip and fired. All men and women for themselves

pros: very team dependent, good ones exist and can accelerate your career
cons: generally the stigma about teams and orgs is true and a bit hard on wlb

summary: Hit or miss, if you land a great team you are set
pros:
* $$$ Compensation skews to the motivated + hard working: if you have yearly good ratings you will be raking in it. Yes, probably even more than Meta or Netflix with very fat refreshers. You can also get promoted very fast.
* [Team dependent, don't work for an internal tool team] Scale is planetary, engineering challenges can be awesome to solve, impact of your work can affect literal hundreds of millions of people every single day. 
* You will skill up fast: the pace of work and the demands of the job will necessarily improve your skillset. If you don't, you will sink.
cons:
* Can be political at times: you need to be good technically AND win the perception game to advance fast and get highest ratings.
* Expectation can get crazy at high levels: expectations do not grow linearly with your level, they grow exponentially. 
* It's all very team and management dependent: if you land in a good team with a good manager, hold on to them for dear life. It's a massive company, you will find any permutation of manager, product and team. Your manager will make or break your career here.
* 5 Day RTO blows
* Culture is swim or sink: expect no hand-holding, everyone is expected to be highly independent.

pros: Pay is good, tools are good. Manager was understanding to some extent
cons: Work life balance is not good, late night calls, 5 days RTO

pros: Fairly steady job. It’s huge so chances of being impacted by layoffs are lower than other tech
cons: 5x a week rto, massive teams that don’t get anything done, promotion path is non existent now

pros: Good learning and great brand. Good for freshers, sets up a foundation for future.
cons: Bad management specially after 2022. No innovation, focus is on cost optimisation.

pros: Competitive compensation , working on customer focused projects, exposure for end to end product lifecycle
cons: No work life balance and personal time ethics. High drop in leadership with lack of future vision

pros: I am working in Retail organization. Work life balance is OK. Good teammates and managers.  Good working environment.
cons: Spending 2+ hours daily on commuting is just not worth it.

summary: Too much work, not enough people
pros:
- Decent comp. But they’re lowering it every chance they get. 
- Good name recognition for your resume
cons:
- Leadership has run out of all ideas 
- Optimizing and cutting costs only 
- Moving teams to India and downleveling
- Cutting roles and giving everyone more work 
- Little to no chance at promotion 
- Forcing RTO5 for no reason 
- Monitoring everything
- Toxic culture

pros:
Good pay.
Strong engineering.
Great learning opportunity for global scale development.
cons:
Too much work.
Cut throat competition.
Not good refresher.
No perks.
